author: radekkapka
content: An external contributor submitted https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/pull/12752 to Prysm recently. Would there be any interest in making this an official endpoint? Querying all validators just to know the number is very expensive.

author: dapplion
content: I in general against adding features without a clear benefit to downstream consumers

author: radekkapka
content: I was thinking it might be interesting to sites such as https://beaconcha.in/ that show the number of active/pending/exiting validators

author: radekkapka
content: but I agree it's just a single use case

author: dapplion
content: The informal process around beacon APIs routes requests could be: make a strong case for the value to the general ecosystem of said route. If there's enough *(subjective) quorum from client teams, then add.

author: dapplion
content:
Other options beside adding a new route are:
- derive the data from another route
- some client adds it on their namespace

author: radekkapka
content: But it's also perfectly fine for us to add it to our own namespace. I am just a little paranoid that someone else will submit a proposal for validator count that will differ from our already existing implementation and we will have a headache ðŸ™‚

author: dapplion
content: I think it's worth it to open a PR on the beaocn API specs for this one, at least to express a direction on how to do it. Would make sense to return the count of validators by status label
